verses.english: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen
verses.hausa: Wani mai tambaya yã yi tambaya game da azãba, mai aukuwa.

verses.english: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
verses.hausa: Ga kãfirai, bã ta da mai tunkuɗẽwa.

verses.english: [It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent.
verses.hausa: Daga Allah Mai matãkala.

verses.arabic: تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
verses.english: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
verses.hausa: Malã'iku da Ruhi (Jibrila) sunã tãkãwa zuwa gare Shi, a cikin yini wanda gwargwadonsa, shẽkara dubu hamsin ne.

verses.english: So be patient with gracious patience.
verses.hausa: Sabõda haka, ka yi haƙuri, haƙuri mai kyãwo.

verses.english: Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
verses.hausa: Lalle ne su, sunã ganin ta mai nĩsa.

verses.english: But We see it [as] near.
verses.hausa: Kuma Mu, Muna ganin ta a kusa.

verses.english: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,
verses.hausa: Rãnar da sama zã ta kasance kamar narkakkar azurfa.

verses.english: And the mountains will be like wool,
verses.hausa: Kuma duwãtsu su zama kamar saɓin sũfi.

verses.english: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,
verses.hausa: Kuma abõki bã ya tambayar inda wani abõki yake.

verses.arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِى مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِيهِ
verses.english: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children
verses.hausa: Ana sanya su, su gajũna, mai laifi na gũrin dã zai iya yin fansa, daga azãbar rãnar nan, da ɗiyansa,

verses.english: And his wife and his brother
verses.hausa: Da matarsa da ɗan'uwansa.

verses.english: And his nearest kindred who shelter him
verses.hausa: Da danginsa, mãsu tattarã shi.

verses.arabic: وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
verses.english: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
verses.hausa: Da wanda ke a cikin dũniya duka gabã ɗaya, sa'an nan fansar, ta tsĩrar da shi.

verses.english: No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
verses.hausa: A'aha! Lalle ne fa, ita ce Lazã,

verses.english: A remover of exteriors.
verses.hausa: Mai twãle fãtar goshi.

verses.english: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
verses.hausa: Tanã kiran wanda ya jũya bãya (daga addini) kuma ya kau da kai.

verses.english: And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
verses.hausa: Ya tãra (dũkiya), kuma ya sanya ta a cikin jaka.

verses.english: Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
verses.hausa: Lalle ne mutum an halitta shi mai ciwon kwaɗayi.

verses.english: When evil touches him, impatient,
verses.hausa: Idan sharri ya shãfe shi, ya kãsa haƙuri.

verses.english: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
verses.hausa: Kuma idan alhẽri ya shãfe shi, ya yi rõwa.

verses.english: Except the observers of prayer -
verses.hausa: Sai mãsu yin salla,

verses.english: Those who are constant in their prayer
verses.hausa: Waɗanda suke, a kan sallarsu, su, mãsu dawwama ne.

verses.english: And those within whose wealth is a known right
verses.hausa: Kuma waɗanda a cikin dũkiyarsu, akwai wani haƙƙi sananne.

verses.english: For the petitioner and the deprived -
verses.hausa: Ga (matalauci) mai rõƙo da wanda aka hanã wa roƙon.

verses.english: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense
verses.hausa: Da waɗannan da ke gaskata rãnar sakamako.

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
verses.english: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
verses.hausa: Da waɗannan sabõda azãbar Ubangijinsu, suna jin tsõro.

verses.english: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
verses.hausa: Lalle ne, azãbar Ubangijinsu bã wadda ake iya amincẽwaba ce.

verses.english: And those who guard their private parts
verses.hausa: Da waɗanda suke, ga farjojinsu, mãsu tsarewa ne.

verses.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
verses.english: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
verses.hausa: Sai fa a kan matan aurensu da abin da hannayensu na dãma suka mallaka. To lalle ne sũkam ba waɗanda ake zargi ba ne.

verses.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
verses.english: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
verses.hausa: To, duk wanda ya nẽmi abin da yake a bayan wannan, to, waɗancan sũ ne mãsu ƙetare iyãka.

verses.english: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive
verses.hausa: Kuma da waɗannan da suke ga amãnõninsu da alkawarinsu mãsu tsarẽwa ne.

verses.english: And those who are in their testimonies upright
verses.hausa: Kuma da waɗanda suke, ga shaidarsu, mãsu dãgẽwa ne.

verses.english: And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
verses.hausa: Kuma waɗanda suke, a kan sallarsu, mãsu tsarẽwa ne.

verses.english: They will be in gardens, honored.
verses.hausa: Waɗannan, a cikin gidãjen Aljanna, waɗanda ake girmamãwa ne

verses.english: So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muhammad],
verses.hausa: Mẽ yã sãmi waɗanda suka kãfirta, a wajenka, sunã gaugãwar (gudu).

verses.english: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?
verses.hausa: Daga jihar dãma, kuma daga jihar hagu, jama'a-jama'a!

verses.arabic: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
verses.english: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
verses.hausa: Shin kõwane mutum daga cikinsu yana nẽman a shigar da shi a Aljannar ni'ima ne (ba da wani aiki ba)?

verses.english: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.
verses.hausa: A'aha! Lalle Mũ, Mun halitta su, daga abin da suka sani.

verses.arabic: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ وَٱلْمَغَـٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
verses.english: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings that indeed We are able
verses.hausa: Sabõda haka ba sai Na yi rantsuwa da Ubangijin wurãren ɓullõwar rãna da wurãren fãɗuwarta ba, lalle Mũ, Mãsu iyãwa ne.

verses.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
verses.english: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.
verses.hausa: Ga Mu musanya waɗanda suke mafi alhẽri, daga gare su. Kuma ba Mu kasance waɗanda ake rinjãya ba.

verses.arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَـٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
verses.english: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -
verses.hausa: Sabõda haka ka bar su, su dulmuya, kuma su yi wãsã, har su haɗu da rãnarsu wadda ake yi musu alkawari (da ita).

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
verses.english: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.
verses.hausa: Rãnar da suke fitowa daga kaburbura da gaugãwa, kamar sũ, zuwa ga wata kafaffiyar (tuta), suke yin gaugãwa.

verses.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
verses.english: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
verses.hausa: Maƙaskanta ga idanunsu, wani walakanci yana rufe su. wannan shi ne yinin da suka kasance ana yi musa alkawari (a kansa.)
